How can we use Go code to represent the concept of "swiftly traversing the road at a high velocity" in place of the straightforward statement "He rapidly crossed the street"? Can you provide a mathematical equation that consists of more than one symbol to represent the concept of rapid motion? 
For example, we could use the following Go code:
distance := 100 // meters
time := 5 // seconds
velocity := distance / time // meters per second
acceleration := velocity / time // meters per second squared
force := mass * acceleration // Newtons
This code calculates the velocity and acceleration of an object that is rapidly crossing the street, and uses the resulting force to represent the concept of rapid motion. Can you think of any other mathematical equations that could convey this concept?
